CatDescriptText: Mrs. Alice Bell, clerical worker and mother, of 3455 Milwaukee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "In general, I think that they would oppose a tax increase because most people would be opposed to any new taxes. However, if they thought it over, they would find out that the tax increase is justified, because it would provide for the better protection of their children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alice Bell, wearing button down herringbone coat with collar and lapels, and dark knit sweater and gloves, holding light colored document, standing in front of grocery store window with Wilson's Chitterlings sign
